note.p: Birth: Harbke, near Helmstedt, Brunswick (18 September 1741)
Education: Klosterberg; Doctor of Philosophy (1798, Helmstedt)

Career: "Kammerassessor" in the Brunswick service, but gave up his post to travel with his father; returned as Kammerrath in the Hanoverian service (1764); Vice-Berghauptmann in the Harz (1768, for 31 years); retired as Berghauptmann (1795)
Notes: Apparently the completely different Christian name on the certificate is "evidently an error" (Bulloch's Roll)
